name: qsv-slice
description: Slice rows from any part of a CSV. When an index is present, this only has to parse the rows in the slice (instead of all rows leading up to the start of the slice).

options.description: The field delimiter for reading CSV data. Must be a single character. (default: ,)
The index of the record to slice to.
Slice a single record (shortcut for -s N -l 1). If negative, starts from the last record.
slice all records EXCEPT those in the specified range.

Output the result as JSON. Fields are written as key-value pairs. The key is the column name. The value is the field value. The output is a JSON array. If --no-headers is set, then the keys are the column indices (zero-based).
The length of the slice (can be used instead of --end).
When set, the first row will not be interpreted as headers. Otherwise, the first row will always appear in the output as the header row.
Write output to <file> instead of stdout.
The index of the record to slice from. If negative, starts from the last record.

examples.description: Slice from the 3rd record to the end
Get everything except the last 10 records
Slice the first three records of the last 10 records
Slice from the second record, two records
Slice records 1 to 9 and 21 to the end as JSON
